item.title: Kafka
item.author: paolo.enrico@gmail.com (Paolo Fullone)
item.description:
We were facing a challenge as a team to move a legacy application to a microservices architecture. The application was built using .NET and was running on a monolithic architecture. We decided to use Kafka as our message broker to decouple the services and allow for asynchronous communication between them.

This application was responsible to retrieve millions of operations on a daily basis and calculate the commission of each associated office and financial advisors.
